text: Aegires incisus is a species of sea slug, a nudibranch, a marine, opisthobranch gastropod mollusk in the family Aegiridae.Bouchet, P. (2010). Aegires incisus (Sars G. O., 1872). In: MolluscaBase (2017). Accessed on 2017-04-24. ==Distribution== This species was described from Norway. It is redescribed by Fahey & Gosliner, (2004).Fahey S.J. & Gosliner T.M. 2004. A phylogenetic analysis of the Aegiridae Fischer, 1883 (Mollusca, Nudibranchia, Phanerobranchia) with descriptions of eight new species and a reassessment of Phanerobranch relationships. Proceedings of the California Academy of Sciences, (4) 55(34): 613–689. ==References== Category:Aegiridae Category:Gastropods described in 1872
title: Aegires incisus
